name.en: Literacy of digital communication and critical thinking
name.ch: 數位傳播素養與批判思考

goal.en: The design objective of this course is to comprehend the processes through which contemporary digital communication impacts the brain, cognition, human behavior, societal influences, cultural perception, and national identity construction. It aims to understand how the self changes and develops under the influence of digital technology and social media, impacting self-perception, reading behaviors, social interactions, information production, and usage. The course also aims to grasp various industries and phenomena influenced by contemporary digital technology and social media, such as marketing, content production, robotics, misinformation, product placement, influencers, online manipulation groups, and trend shaping. Students will learn how to examine digital tools to prevent the harm caused by misinformation, discern facts, and conduct fact-checking. Moreover, they‘ll delve into critical analysis and oversight of media platforms, participate in and practice citizen discussions, and engage in democratic practices. Ultimately, the course seeks to cultivate and empower digital literacy, enabling individuals to critically evaluate, participate in, and contribute to discussions and democratic practices in digital communication.
goal.ch: 本課程的設計目的，在於理解當代數位傳播對於大腦、思考、人類行為、社會影響、文化認知與國族建構的過程；理解自我在數位科技、社群媒體影響下的改變與發展，如何影響自我的認知、閱讀行為、社群交往、資訊生產與使用；理解當代數位科技與社群媒體影響下各種行銷、內容生產、機器人、假訊息、置入性行銷、網紅、網軍、帶風向等產業與現象；學習如何檢視數位工具防止假訊息的危害、判讀事實與進行事實查詢；學習如何批判與監督媒體；學習如何參與與實踐公民討論與民主實踐，達成數位傳播素養的培育與培力。

content.en:
Week 1: Course Introduction
Week 2: What is Truth? Metaphysical and Epistemological Approaches
Week 3: Imagined Communities: Communication Patterns and National Identity
Week 4: Attention Merchants: Digital Communication and Market Marketing
Week 5: How to Get Addicted: How Social Platforms Influence Our Lives
Week 6: Fake News and Their Origins
Week 7: Content Farms
Week 8: Echo Chambers and Word-of-Mouth Marketing
Week 9: Tools and Methods for Fact-Checking
Week 10: Netizens and Keyboard Warriors: Unruly Anonymous Justice
Week 11: Geopolitics and Information Warfare
Week 12: Live Streaming, Influencers, and Memes
Week 13: Should Digital Platforms Be Regulated, and How?
Week 14: Public Media and High-Quality Media
Week 15: Final Project Presentation
Week 16: Final Project Presentation
content.ch:
第一週 課程介紹
第二週 真相是什麼？形上學和知識論進路
第三週 想像的共同體：傳播模式與國族認同
第四週 注意力商人：數位傳播與市場行銷
第五週 如何上癮：社群平台如何影響我們的生活
第六週 假新聞與他們的產地
第七週 種瓜得豆：內容農場
第八週 與論操縱與口碑行銷
第九週 事實查核的工具與方法
第十週 鄉民與鍵盤俠：失控的匿名正義
第十一週 地緣政治與資訊戰
第十二週 直播、網紅與梗圖
第十三週 數位平台該不該管、該怎麼管？
第十四週 公共媒體與優質媒體
第十五週 期末成果報告
第十六週 期末成果報告
